resources.string: Cyllell maintains a local cache of Node, Role & Environment names and URI\'s to improve the responsiveness of the app.\nThis only has to be done once.
For best results use a short single word to describe the name or role of the node(s) you are searching for.
Issues the command to create the local SQLite database.\n(Moving this app to an SD card might be a good idea)
Issues a series of SQLite instructions to create the tables that will store the local cache of info
Queries the /nodes/ endpoint of your Chef server to build a list of all nodes and their URI\'s
Queries the /roles/ endpoint of your Chef server to build a list of all roles and their URI\'s
Queries the /environments/ endpoint of your Chef server to build a list of all the environments and their URI\'s

Chef is an open-source systems integration framework built specifically for automating the cloud. No matter how complex the realities of your business, Chef makes it easy to deploy servers and scale applications throughout your entire infrastructure. Because it combines the fundamental elements of configuration management and service oriented architectures with the full power of Ruby, Chef makes it easy to create an elegant, fully automated infrastructure

Cyllell works similar to knife allowing you to;

 	 List nodes, view and edit the run list
 	 List all environments and make edits
 	 List cookbooks and view all cookbook meta data
 	 List and edit roles
 	 Search with knife search syntax or a GUI
 
 Simply select one of the tabs above to get started.
Ensure your device time matches that on your Chef server otherwise authentication will fail.
